title: vymo - Solutions Specialist
subtitle: Location - Mumbai, Work Type: Full Time
content:
About Vymo

Vymo (https://www.getvymo.com) is one of the fastest-growing SaaS companies in the world with the mission to help sales teams #DoMore. It’s a mobile-first Personal Sales Assistant - a first of its kind - that automatically captures sales activities and predicts ‘next best actions’ contextually by learning from top sales reps. Headquartered in San Francisco, the company houses over 200+ people across seven offices globally.

Vymo is the distribution excellence cloud trusted by over 125,000users across 60+ leading enterprises such as AXA, Allianz, Generali, AIA, and more. A Gartner ‘Cool Vendor’, Vymo is funded by Emergence Capital & Sequoia Capital. The company has seen 3x YoY growth over the last few years and aspires to do even better this year by building up a truly global and diverse team.

What is the Personal Sales Assistant - A game-changer!

We thrive in the CRM space where every company struggles to deliver meaningful engagement & contextual analytics to their Sales teams. But even the best CRMs in the world have an adoption rate of less than 30%. Vymo was engineered with a mobile-first philosophy to help remote sales teams operate more efficiently in a deskless environment. With its powerful intelligence engine, the platform captures sales activities automatically and learns how to make Sales Representatives more productive through nudges and suggestions on a mobile device. That’s why over 85% of salespeople use Vymo daily.

Watch Vymo in action - https://youtu.be/9saePnvir4MM

A Day in your Life

  • Gather deep understanding of the Customers business processes as they stand without Vymo
  • Understand their biggest pain points and gaps across all levels in the hierarchy
  • Understand the technology landscape and any need for system integrations as part of overall solutioning.
  • Work with Customer to define the optimum solution within the boundaries of the Vymo product offerings
  • Creation of detailed Business Requirement Docs based on the proposed solution
  • Engage with client IT/ISG teams, to elicit and document the requirements of the non-functional areas (Security/Performance etc.)
  • Work with various internal teams setup, configure and deliver the solution to the Customer
  • Build consensus with the service delivery team on the customer deliverables.
  • Training Client teams on all aspects of the solution
  • Work with Client functional groups and internal teams to identify enhancements and processes changes as per client’s ever changing business requirement to drive positive Customer impact.
  • Establishing a professional working relationship with clients demonstrates ability to grow relationships and build credibility with key clients contacts at all levels.
  • Provide on-ground feedback to the product teams to improve the solution offerings
  • Arrive at the best technical solution approach that is within our product boundaries
  • Be an advocate to the customer for all technical queries

    • What you would have done

    • Have the industry experience of 3 - 5 Yrs as Solution Architect or Pre Sales and Implementation consulting.
    • Have an educational background of Engineering and related disciplines ( BCA )
    • Have internal (Engineering) and external stakeholder management (executive stakeholders )
    • Have Functional product know-how of Enterprise-grade Workflow, CRM and AI systems
    • Have deep expertise and Solution engineering capabilities like delivering great product demonstration, responding to RFI/ RFP’s, project scoping & creating SOWs

title: vymo - Strategic Account Director
subtitle: Location - Mumbai, Work Type: Full Time
content:
About Vymo

Vymo is a San Francisco -based next-generation Sales productivity SaaS company with offices in 7 locations. Vymo is funded by top tier VC firms like Emergence Capital and Sequoia Capital. Vymo is a category creator, an intelligent Personal Sales Assistant who captures sales activities automatically, learns from top performers, and predicts ‘next best actions’ contextually. Vymo has 300,000 users in 60+ large enterprises such as AXA, AIA, Generali, and Aflac. Vymo has seen 3x annual growth over the last few years and aspires to do even better this year by building up the team globally.

What is the Personal Sales Assistant - A game-changer!

We thrive in the CRM space where every company struggles to deliver meaningful engagement & contextual analytics to their Sales teams. But even the best CRMs in the world have an adoption rate of less than 30%. Vymo was engineered with a mobile-first philosophy to help remote sales teams operate more efficiently in a deskless environment. With its powerful intelligence engine, the platform captures sales activities automatically and learns how to make Sales Representatives more productive through nudges and suggestions on a mobile device. That’s why over 85% of salespeople use Vymo daily.

Watch Vymo in action - https://youtu.be/9saePnvir4MM

Do you thrive on consulting closely with large enterprise clients on their core business objectives? Are you looking for truly fascinating and inspiring work, where you will work alongside an amazing team, harnessing the power of an extraordinary product, for a company with unlimited growth potential?

If the answer is yes, then look no further.

Success in this position requires the candidate to be a ninja at managing relationships, execute programs, set goals and metrics, track and ensure progress.

As a Strategic Account Director, you will be required to work across the Vymo Account Team (Customer success, Project Management, Solutioning, Presales, Services Team) and internal / client leadership teams to improve customer satisfaction, retention and expansion of Vymo’s footprint across the organization. You will maintain a single-minded focus to ensure the Account is extracting the most value out of their Vymo investment and efforts of all Account Team personnel assigned to the account are coordinated and reported regularly to internal and customer executives. You will be responsible for setting customers up for success from the very beginning of a sales cycle and orchestrating and program-managing the success plan in each phase of the customer lifecycle thereafter.

Your leadership style is human-centric and you know that the best solutions are co-created by engaged and empowered teams. You have successfully navigated the, often sophisticated, relationships between Lines of Business and IT - you know how to bring out the best in our Customers as a player and coach.

What will you do every day?

  • Build, maintain and leverage strong relationships with Decision Makers (Business and IT) to influence solution adoption, create strong support for new opportunities and to secure their willingness to advocate on Vymo’s behalf
  • Create a network of champions in the Account who can help create a network effect and increase our penetration in the Account & overall Account Health.
  • Develop a strategy for the account that identifies its critical success factors, measurable milestones, potential obstacles and recommended plan of action
  • Provide technology thought leadership to customers by aligning technology Cross solutions to their digital transformation needs; evangelize Vymo across Business Units and corresponding stakeholders.
  • Complete ownership of Account Health and revenue management - Work on the account growth strategy for clients, i.e retention and strategies to grow revenue through upselling of new offerings and products.
  • Drive cross-functional account planning, provide ideas on driving around driving growth on accounts and then drive the execution of that plan to success
  • Farming - Discover and evangelize new use cases for the customer through strategic value based selling, business case definition, ROI analysis and cross channel references. Competition mapping and understanding the key differences between us vs our competitors.
  • Own and close complex decision cycles, involving several stakeholders and intra organizational teams. Report and forecast revenue generation activity to sales management.
  • Bring back customer captured intelligence to Vymo product, strategy, and services team to improve Vymo products and services;
  • Accountable for customer and Vymo stakeholders throughout the entire customer lifecycle; simultaneously manage multiple channels / projects which are at different points on the lifecycle. Build and program-manage impactful joint success plans with executive sign off; drive processes and team to Success and meet Account Goals (customer satisfaction, revenue, profitability, upsell & cross sell).
  • Orchestrate and influence a matrixed multi-disciplinary team (including Vymo leadership) to align efforts and maximize impact for customers
  • Create value for the customer by ensuring they clearly define business outcomes and then build a “success plan” along with Vymo Account Team (primarily with the Customer Success Team) with the appropriately identified objectives, stakeholders, milestones, risks and metrics needed to achieve them; Achieve maximum ROI by bringing the right resource at the right time with clear decisions in prioritization.
  • Orchestrate the cross-functional support required to ensure that Vymo implementations are delivered to meet client expectations: Track and resolve key client issues in a proactive manner and manage expectations internally and externally; lead planning workshops and program steering committee meetings; Implement & improve the defined governance processes as needed.
  • Where appropriate and required for the Account Success, providing direct oversight to the project team during the full lifecycle of the engagement, acting as the escalation point for both the customer and Vymo delivery teams
  • Learn about each channel’s business priorities and review channel / customer metrics to gain a deeper understanding of account health, drawing conclusions while identifying trends and potential risks, while driving value conversations with customers
  • Perform rapid assessment of landscape for clients and provide insights to accelerate action towards refining their current state
  • Keep up with the trends in the industry and platform capabilities of the competition; Educate customers on sales tech and provide best practices to optimize the consumption of Vymo.

    • About You -

    • You have 10+ years of customer facing B2B Enterprise software experience, ideally in a Account Management, Sales, Customer Success, Program Management or Consulting role
    • You have a deep understanding of the Financial Services industry and digital transformation, especially with large Financial Services organizations
    • You demonstrate deep Account Management skills. Have experience of growing accounts with large and complex pursuits ($M+) and exceeding revenue achievement.
    • You have a track record of deeply understanding products and how they deliver value to complex customers with large employee bases
    • You are Client-Obsessed: You live for your clients, know their businesses inside out from strategic objectives to organizational structures. And network at the highest possible levels across your portfolio to ensure there is appropriate executive level engagement
    • You are consultative and are able to navigate the complexities and needs of clients across industry and lifecycle with the ability to apply your expertise contextually
    • You have understanding of project management techniques and tools for large complex business transformation projects; with experience in developing and executing project governance methodologies.
    • You have the capability to recognize complicated customer and internal relationships and navigate win/win outcomes for multiple stakeholders.
    • You have a proven ability to guide, lead and coach client leadership / project teams across the lifecycle of complex programs and strategic initiatives
    • You have the ability to mobilize and inspire a diverse and geographically dispersed Vymo Account Team to drive successful business outcomes for the customer.
    • You are a teacher at heart with the ability to distill technical or complex systems into simpler concepts to empower customers
    • You exhibit thought leadership and genuine curiosity of Digital Trends and emerging technology.
    • You are a self-starter-- willing to put fingerprints on the work.
    • You have excellent communication skills. Remember communication is not what you say but what other people understand.
    • You have the ability to thrive in a fast-paced, unpredictable environment
    • You are a resourceful and creative problem solver, never losing sight of the “why” behind the “what”

About Vymo: Who we are, What we do

Vymo is among the fastest growing enterprise SaaS startups in the world. In plain speak, our deal sizes are in 6 or 7 figures and what we do isn’t just convenient, it is critical to our customers.

For instance, if you turn off Vymo for a day - you halt business as usual for Asia’s largest Insurer, the 12th largest bank in the world, and 60 other large enterprises that depend on Vymo to enable salespeople and delight customers.

Customers don’t just buy our products off the shelf. It isn’t a see-click-buy-use experience, but a consult-solution-contract-deploy experience with significant investment from both sides. Our destinies are tied inextricably.

And with great power comes great responsibility. So, we don’t just hire people who can hack, break, or ship, we hire folks who can tinker, iterate, and solve meaningfully for our customers. And also, for us.

  • Title : Inside Sales Representative
  • Location: Bengaluru
  • Work Timing: Same as Target Market

Requirement

  • Motivated, self-starter with a desire to excel; Go-getter with ‘will figure out’ attitude
  • Experience: ISR (4 to 6 Years) Senior ISR (5 to 8 Years)

Job Function:

  • Inside sales would be responsible to open doors for sales reps to enter and sell. In this endeavor, reps are expected to conduct market research, gather account level intelligence, source their own leads, set up appointments, find opportunities, build pipeline, hard qualify and pass onto sales.
  • Additionally, account nurture for strategic accounts, independently running conversations and demo showcasing abilities would be critical to the role.

Responsibilities

  • Market Research: account, territory and industry vertical based - Insights driven research at account/contact level
  • Prospecting: Probe, Reach-out, Run discovery calls, stakeholder mapping
  • Scoping: Understand requirements, position Vymo and generate interest
  • Named account Navigation: Ability to navigate within identified accounts, use references to go deep and wide.
  • Account Presence: Establish trust with key contacts, establish high level of activity
  • Sourcing and scheduling meetings: Outbound centric appointment setting
  • Opportunity sourcing: identifying relevant opportunities based on Vymo fitment
  • Opportunity qualification: Criteria based - TEMP and BANT
  • Pipeline building: Ensuring a good funnel for steady opportunity flow
  • Sales Support: Targeted outreach to accelerate opportunity for sales reps - set up CXO and senior stakeholder meetings when required
  • Set the tone:· Present and articulate product features, Vymo value and benefits

Responsibilities

  • Communication: written and oral - Active listening, tonality, bonding & rapport building
  • Hustle: Hunger to learn, Motivation to win, experimentally curious
  • Confidence: Never say die spirit, Hunter mindset
  • Coachability: ability to learn new things, unlearn non-relevant practices
  • Demo Skills: Steady, smooth and engaging – generate interest and address concerns
  • Iteration: Ability to continuously repeat, try new approaches until goal is reached
  • Objection handling: Data driven, factual and confidence building
  • Time Management: Ability to multitask, work in a fast-paced environment

Requisites

  • Prior experience working in B2B, SAAS based start-ups
  • Outbound ability to independently source, qualify leads before transition to sales
  • Having prospected/sold into large enterprises specifically within IT
  • Experience in dealing with High ticket, low volume, long sales cycle sales environment
  • Inherent Inside sales skills – not too new with zero experience
  • Ability to connect the dots, client personas and research into a compelling pitch
  • Prior objection handling experience & critical thinking
  • Outstanding relationship building skills with high degree of responsiveness and integrity
  • Past Success: Demonstrated track record of consistently beating numbers on QoQ basis

Other Skills:

  • Team Player - · Energetic, upbeat, tenacious
  • Flexible to work in shifts (as per territory/region assigned)

content:

  • not looking for a new job, but a new challenge

  • empathetic and kind to customers & colleagues

They also likely,

  • have started stuff (startups, projects, communities)
  • are living their passion (code, design, marketing), and
  • have a well thought out perspective on their work

If that sounds like you, then we should talk.

NOTE: we love interesting conversations with passionate people, but we also won’t string you along for months on end. It’s either a HELL YES or a no from us. ++ You can expect cakes and cookies in the mail.

About the role: Head of Creative - Brand Design

The ‘Head of Creative’ role was conceived to help us engage with prospects and customers more meaningfully across mediums.

It will generally involve working with designers, animators, copywriters, and growth marketers to solve a stated problem like,

  • How can we accelerate sales opportunities (they need us, they love us, but how can we get them off their behinds to use us)?
  • How can we increase adoption for Vymo (how can we communicate to people who have always viewed tech with suspicion)?
  • How do we increase conversions on campaigns (are we saying the right things well enough to move CXOs to action)?
  • How can we hire the best engineers (inspiring love for the kind of work we do and who we are without offering BMW bikes)?
  • How can we fight fatigue and burnout (engaging 300+ people remotely and recreating the visceral energy of the office floor)?

You get the drift.

We believe putting shapes and figures together on a beautiful, compelling interface is the lowest resolution of a design solution, much less a creative one.

We like Alchemy.

That is Part I.

The second, and wholly important part is marshalling the people and resources at your disposal to create this alchemy.

You will have to,

  • Work with Growth, Customer Success, HR, and other teams to align their operational requirements into something more strategic. Nobody just needs banners.
  • Define the vision for your team and help them do the best work of their life. This involves getting rid of ambiguity, and investing in their growth.
  • Discover our brand ground up and figure how to best represent us. This will involve actually understanding users, customers, employees, investors, and other stakeholders.
  • Translate our brand values and aesthetics to EVERYTHING. Processes, templates, guidelines, workshops and whatever else is required to make sure we’re pixel perfect.
  • Help the function evolve from support to strategy. That means defining work proactively for your team and function, building for scale and moving the needle.

OK, but what will I build?

  • Design language & systems: that can help the team ship high quality work in a predictable way while striving for truly global benchmarks.
  • Product marketing collateral: decks, docs, web pages, films explaining our value proposition to diverse audiences across 6 different geographies
  • Brand communication: communicating Vymo’s values via different mediums to customers, employees, investors, and other stakeholders.

Does all of this sound way too exciting for a B2B company?

A B2B Company

That’s because we are NOT a conventional B2B company. Over the last 7 years, we have reinvented every B2B tenet worth revisiting, including and not limited to:

  • Enterprise software is not built for user love: our daily adoption is 2.5x average
  • Cannot close 7 figure deals out of India: we have large customers in 6 countries
  • B2B marketing is about decks & booths: we make art, films, and craft experiences.

So, we don’t consider Design or Creative a support function. We believe Creative is integral to crafting experiences that move people to action.

Because, even B2B companies work with people.

You have to work harder to understand our context. It may not be as simple as understanding why people buy sugary drinks or suits and ties. But, decisions are made by people with flesh and blood, and not insular, inanimate organizations.

Solve higher-order problems.

Is this right for you? Let’s see...

We don’t believe we’re right for everyone. We have made enough mistakes to understand what works for us and most importantly, what doesn’t.

If you’re reading this, it’s because your profile reflects the qualities we see in a potential hire. We’re approaching this role purely as an outbound activity.

You must necessarily have,

  • 6-10 years of experience leading Creative teams
  • strong design fundamentals across mediums
  • built teams, processes, and brands from scratch

If that’s not you, then we apologize for wasting your time. 🙏🏽

Also, we need someone with a strong perspective, but you must marry that with the necessary curiosity and humility to discover our brand and do what’s right for us. We don’t want you transposing what you’ve done before in our context.

Further, you must want to,

  • really understand our product and market, even the “boring” bits
  • be a manager and coach and set the north star for our people
  • commit to a five year journey from hereon to IPO and beyond

If you are not in that mindspace right now then this won’t work out.

You can’t want this passively. It will have to consume you.

You will be spending a significant portion of your waking hours thinking about our mission. You will have to obsess about what we can do better each day.

We understand that this kind of commitment doesn’t happen overnight, but you must be willing to invest in the process at least. Because, we will. 100%.

The Hiring Process: ~2 weeks

  • 1:1 30 min open ended chat with VP-Marketing
  • Purpose is to understand each others’ aspirations, and
  • If we have the right vibe together

  • Benchmarks of what you think is amazing
  • How it could be relevant for Vymo today

  • Educate us about your thought process
  • How will this fit in our scheme of things

Coaching & Enablement

  • 1:1 60 min discussion with managers

  • How do you see our future evolving

Culture Fit / How will we work together

  • 30 min with the Marketing team @ Vymo
  • How will your next 30 - 60 - 90 days look
  • What do you need to be truly successful

Why join Vymo? Why now

  • Start with a blank page, quite literally: your opportunity to revisit conventions, reinvent what is necessary to build things ground up.
  • Ground zero, scaling a SaaS unicorn: do what it takes to move the needle and scale the next SAAS unicorn, have a story to tell
  • The smartest of the smart people: work with the smartest, most driven people in the business, and amplify your capabilities
  • Complete ownership, no half-measures: own your work, end to end, from concept to execution with minimal intervention from anyone.
  • Enjoy a truly diverse, global culture: we’re spread across continents and are a melting pot of cultures; become a richer version of you

Role

We are looking for a Learning and Development (L&D) SPOC who will be responsible for developing and implementing an organization-wide Learning & Development strategy that facilitates and drives individual development and capacity building in line with our organizational goals.

This position will involve collaborating effectively with people at all job levels and interacting with a diverse group of individuals and personalities to ensure the achievement of individual, functional and organizational goals.

You should be passionate about helping people learn and grow. Excellent communication skills are essential along with experience in designing curriculums, and courses and managing budgets. Ultimately, you will help our company succeed by training and developing its people.

title: vymo - Customer Support Leader
subtitle: Location - Bangalore, Work Type: Full Time
content:
Vymo is a San Francisco-based next-generation Sales productivity SaaS company with offices in 7 locations. Vymo is funded by top-tier VC firms like Emergence Capital and Sequoia Capital. Vymo is a category creator, an intelligent Personal Sales Assistant who captures sales activities automatically learns from top performers, and predicts ‘next best actions’ contextually. Vymo has 100,000 users in 60+ large enterprises such as AXA, Allianz, and Generali. Vymo has seen 3x annual growth over the last few years and aspires to do even better this year by building up the team globally.

What is the Personal Sales Assistant

A game-changer! We thrive in the CRM space where every company is struggling to deliver meaningful engagement to their Sales teams and IT systems. Vymo was engineered with a mobile-first philosophy. The platform through AI/ML detects, predicts, and learns how to make Sales Representatives more productive through nudges and suggestions on a mobile device. Explore Vymo https://getvymo.com/

What you will do at Vymo

Our Customer Support Leader reporting to the Chief Customer Officer will be a key part of the Customer leadership team, working cross-functionally with Customer Success, Professional Services function, Product Management, Engineering, and Sales function.

The leader of Global Customer Support will build a world-class customer-centric highly skilled global customer support organization that is ultimately responsible for resolving all customer support tickets in a timely manner with the highest level of CSAT.

We are looking for an experienced leader who is capable of running the day-to-day activities of our Support Team, as well as setting and executing the long-term vision and roadmap of the function. You have experience leading, coaching, and motivating a team to deliver high-quality, efficient, and empathetic customer service in a high-volume, fast-paced environment. Your team is the contact point for all of our internal teams and all of our clients.

Responsibilities

  • Lead a world-class Customer Support team with ultimate responsibility for resolving all customer support tickets to customer satisfaction.
  • Partner with Product and Engineering teams on support-readiness for new products and features launch.
  • Partner with the Product and Engineering team and develop and prioritize a list of product improvements resulting in support ticket reduction.
  • Develop a team of subject matter experts to help drive timely resolution to complex product areas
  • Execute plays based on data-driven support health scores.
  • Establish support metrics to proactively assess and compute internal customer satisfaction score
  • Mentor and inspire a team of strong, intellectually curious customer support engineers to create a truly differentiating function for Onfido.
  • Support both high-touch and automated, self-service approaches to help customers meet their objectives.
  • Provide data and insights to the rest of the company in order to proactively improve product and customer experience, resulting in lower support tickets..
  • Help develop different customer support offerings to meet the needs of various customer segments.
  • Develop a clear career ladder for customer support engineers, providing them with a clear career growth path.
  • Use appropriate analytical tools to determine the preferred support strategy
  • Help enhance our self-service Support portal with an increasingly rich Knowledgebase
  • Use appropriate analytical tools to determine the preferred customer support strategy.
  • Manage and scale-up global customer support teams.
  • Be a champion of delivering a delightful experience to our customers.

Key activities:

  • You will manage the day-to-day activities of the Support Team.
  • You will recruit, train, and onboard new Support teammates.
  • You will be responsible for building the next level of leadership within the team.
  • You will be responsible for maintaining high levels of customer service and commitment to SLAs.
  • You will develop and monitor data dashboards to provide a complete picture of the state of operations. You will proactively and clearly communicate these results to the rest of the organization.
  • You will be responsible for global customer support management for domestic and international clients
  • You will work closely with our clients to set up onsite support teams to improve SLA and customer satisfaction.
  • You will serve as an advocate for internal teams and clients. You are obsessed with customer success and driving long-term customer value.
  • You will proactively conduct outreach and maintain productive communications with internal teams and clients to get feedback, improve satisfaction, and prevent churn.
  • You will act as a point of escalation for complex customer questions, and you will organize cross-functional teams as needed to resolve any escalations.
  • You will provide RCA for high-severity incidents and work with internal teams and clients to avoid repetition of the same.
  • You will use data to improve existing processes, drive product recommendations, and scale operations.
  • You will help our product and service get better by funneling users' feedback, issues, and requests into the product's roadmap.
  • You will help build out and manage a data-driven staffing model for the team that aligns with operational volumes and arrival patterns and build a strong knowledge base and repository to support that
  • You will drive continuous improvement initiatives to improve operating efficiency and improve CSAT
  • You will own the training materials used to effectively onboard new Support teammates and scale the team.
  • You will own the onboarding guides used to effectively onboard new clients.
  • You will enjoy great teamwork, have lots of fun, and take pride in building a world-class product that makes a difference in people's lives.

Requirements:

  • Experience managing a global customer support operation in a B2B environment; with a team size of at least 100 customer support members; and managed at least 50 clients for SaaS or subscription-based software company
  • Experience managing complex escalations in enterprise B2B environments.
  • 15+ years in Customer Support, Technical Support, and/or Escalation Support including at least 5 years in a leadership role.
  • Experience working cross-functionally across all departments Customer Success, Professional Services function, Product Management, Engineering, and Sales/Pre-Sales
  • Experience recruiting, growing, retaining, and scaling teams.
  • Experience with ticketing systems for email-based support.
  • Analytical and metrics-driven with a proven track record of making decisions based on data.
  • Great technical understanding of complex products and systems.
  • Ability to support a team that provides a timely service seven days a week.
  • Ambitious, hardworking, execution-oriented, eager to get results and succeed.
Apply

  • High NPS/CSAT score – NPS > 40, CSAT > 8/10
  • Logo & Gross MRR Churn – less than 10% attrition in MRR across the portfolio
  • Net Retention – 150% of MRR across the portfolio (net expansion in user base)
  • Customer advocacy – references, testimonials, referrals from clients
  • Driving timely delivery of client asks/requirements – working closely with the delivery organization

A Day in your Life

  • Engage with Project SPOCs and Business Sponsors at client organizations on various aspects, including but not limited to:
    • Open CRs/Bugs – status, plans & prioritization;
    • Performance review – adoption/engagement, activities/outcomes, outliers & other actionable insights, next steps;
    • Client business-related developments and related strategic initiatives planned by the client and by extension, expectations from Vymo in the coming months;
    • Observed feature gaps & related notional loss for the client and related next steps;
    • New features launched & potential value for the client and actions thereof;
    • Scheduling & running regular governance meetings – SteerCos, QBRs;
    • User NPS scores/planned actions for improving the same; support required from the client;
    • User engagement access/feedback – FGDs, interviews, 1:1 with hero users/nonusers;
    • Executing renewals playbook & supporting sales and other leadership team in this regard.
  • Update the tool, ‘ChurnZero’ for all your clients facing engagements and tasks emanating from such engagements; assign responsibilities to relevant people internally for actions to be delivered by them.
  • Schedule and run internal cadence calls with the cross-functional team supporting your client accounts (Delivery Manager, Solution Specialist, Developers, QA) sharing the necessary insights/feedback from client discussions, especially agreed items to be delivered in the coming months (Client Delivery Plan)
  • Review progress against monthly sprint plans prepared by the Service Delivery team to deliver the client asks for the given month, as agreed with the client as above.
  • Periodically engage with users, managers of your clients to enable the following:
    • Understand their immediate priorities and assess how Vymo could help them with those;
    • Understand their underlying reasons for using/not using Vymo and assess interventions needed to successfully address their concerns;
    • Demonstrate to them how Vymo could make their lives simpler and the value we could add to them on account of the data-driven insights generated by Vymo.
  • For new clients, use our “Success Roadmap Framework” to help build a bespoke “Success Roadmap” that outlines the key success metrics that both parties mutually agree to jointly drive during each stage of the client onboarding lifecycle.
  • As part of the periodic engagement with clients, revisit the success metrics agreed at inception to refine and align them to extant business priorities of the client for the upcoming quarter. Ensure the necessary alignment of deliverables at our end to successfully deliver on the revised focus areas/metrics.
  • Introduce new product features launched by Vymo to your clients and generate awareness and interest amongst them to adopt these new features.
  • You are not responsible for cross-selling and up-sell into your client account, but for identifying such opportunities and passing them over to the Sales team who would take them forward. For e.g. additional distribution channels or other processes that can be supported by Vymo and are currently not part of our solution.
  • Support the Marketing team in arranging for any surveys, references, testimonials required by them and/or getting speakers from the client organizations for client events

What you would have done

  • MBA from a premier institute, Graduation in Engineering/Business
  • Have 12+ years of work experience in high touch customer-facing roles such as Customer Success, Account Management, Strategy Consulting, and/or SaaS/Enterprise Software companies
  • Have experience in engaging with senior stakeholders. Equally at ease in dealing effectively with end-users, managers, project SPOCs & business sponsors and building a rapport with them
  • Have the ability to communicate clearly and effectively with executive-level sponsors as well as technical practitioners
  • Have experience of navigating a start-up ecosystem - externally and internally and is a self-motivated team player
  • Have strong empathy for customers and a passion for customer’s success, takes a data-driven approach towards customer adoption & managing success through outcomes
  • Exceptional Account Management, organizational, consulting, project management and interpersonal skills
  • Consistent record as a top performer in a customer-facing role and have met or exceeded customer retention goals and applicable success metrics
  • Have experience in handling challenging situations and clients and demonstrated capabilities in winning them over.
Apply

Why do you want to do this? ● Customer profiling (15 mins) ○ What are 3 different types of ideal customer profile (ICP) for UrbanPiper (be specific in your criteria)? ○ How does our value proposition to them differ? ○ Conduct an interview with 3 restaurateurs, ideally with each one representing one of the ICP’s you’ve identified. (15 mins) Task 2 (10 mins): Enlighten us with your biggest passion in life - take any one topic that is closest to your heart and go deep into it. This could be a hobby, sport, or a social cause you feel the most about. Please share the solution with your recruiter in a shareable format using Google Docs, optimized to be presented to a panel in 1 hour. This exercise is intentionally ambiguous and we suggest that you explicitly define your assumptions. The team will review your case study and if successful, invite you to present it live.

title: rivigo - Program Manager, Operation Excellence
subtitle: Location - Gurugram, Work Type: Full Time
content:
About Rivigo

We are a technology-enabled company that is shaping the future of logistics for the world. Founded in 2014, we are transforming the sector with our global-first driver relay model made possible through a unique mix of next generation data science and operational excellence. Grounded in the mission of making logistics human, we have fundamentally changed the truck driver’s job from a ‘months-away-from-home’ job to a ‘day’ job. Unlike conventional truck drivers, relay pilots drive from pitstop to pitstop (under 300 kms) and return to their families the same day, thus, creating huge social dividend.

Relay trucking also ensures 50-70% reduction in turnaround time and highest reliability for clients, helping them reinvent their business models – serving new markets, reducing inventory and significantly cutting costs. Listed among the world’s top emerging businesses and backed by marquee investors, we are working on a vision to build a completely technology-enabled RaaS (Relay as a service) marketplace to define the way goods move on roads in India and the world.

What will you do?

  • Identifying, prioritizing and implementing initiatives to improve productivity, quality, customer service and/or reducing costs and complexity
  • Develop, implement and govern KPIs reporting for the portfolio of programs, providing visibility to the milestones and performance across all projects.
  • Develop and maintain operational excellence project plans, identify resource needs, and manage project schedule; collaborate effectively across teams to agree timelines and deliverable.  Continually challenge the status quo and persistently dig for improvement opportunities
  • Establish a passion for operational excellence within operations  Manage large highly complex programs that will accelerate operational, productivity and customer experience improvement across the organization.
  • Serve as facilitator and champion for operational excellence across the company. Coach, mentor and support colleagues in achievement of initiatives and targets.
  • Apply analytical expertise on operations to conceptualize projects, build stakeholder alignment, and drive projects to achieve strategic goals / rationalize cost & quality performance

Who we are looking for ?

  • Engineer/MBA with 2 - 4 years of experience in consulting, CI or Ops excellence role
  • Ability to influence stakeholders across the organization without direct reporting lines
  • Proven experience and knowledge of process improvement tools, methods, and techniques
  • Proven experience in driving continuous improvement initiatives
  • Substantial experience in program/project management or an equivalent operational role
  • Ability to interpret, analyse, and understand complex data sets

The Analytics Lead will lead the analytics & BI department and oversee the activities of a team of business analysts and work closely with the program management and strategy team. In this role, the Analytics Lead ensures that the business in its various departments understands and owns its own health, finds growth levers, and identifies opportunities for optimization. The Analytics Lead leads the business through all efforts that drive business performance and potential by using the existing and new data sources and techniques. The role will involve the Analytics Lead getting his or her hands dirty and solving hard analytical problems for the business, taking a seat at the table alongside Engineering, Product, Business, Category, and Marketing, in strategy and planning.

Segment-wise Descriptions for the role of -

1) Building and managing the entire analytics team

  • The Analytics Lead will play a leading strategic role to lead the data analytics and data warehousing departments in strategy development with regard to the collection, manipulation, and analysis of data for various business functions/departments such as marketing, sales, and operations, among others.
  • Ensure a capable team is aligned to and deployed against projects with the highest business impact
  • Help analysts and business intelligence engineers achieve their goals
  • Explain complicated stats or data technology concepts to them and train them to be high-impact analysts.

2) Drive technology requirements and investments that make analytics a strategic advantage for the company

  • Driving the day-to-day analytical approaches and exploring solutions to particular problems
  • Unified view of customer data across tools and services used by the business
  • Review and analyze the effectiveness and efficiency of existing systems and develop strategies for improving or further leveraging these systems.
  • Oversee the design and delivery of reports and insights that analyze business functions and key operations and performance metrics.
  • Anticipate future demands of initiatives related to people, technology, budget, and business within your team and design/implement solutions to meet these needs.

  • Anticipate future demands of initiatives related to people, technology, budget, and business within your department and design/implement solutions to meet these needs.

  • Strong SQL skills, ability to perform effective querying involving multiple tables and subqueries.
  • Understanding of and experience using analytical concepts and statistical techniques: hypothesis development, designing tests/experiments, analyzing data, drawing conclusions, and developing actionable recommendations for business units.

title: kissht - Information Security Officer
subtitle: Location -  Mumbai, Work Type: Full time
content:
Job Description

The Information Security Officer will work closely with inefficient formulation, implementation, and management of the Bank's information security policy(s) and compliance programs. The incumbent will ensure efficient management of Information Security Governance, in line with the Reserve Bank of India and other statutory/regulatory bodies governing our India operations. He/she will also coordinate and execute the information security management system program (ISMS), Security operations, VAPT program, and Cyber Security Framework implementation. The job holder will also ensure that risk management needs in relation to information security, including but not limited to incident response, access control, business continuity and disaster recovery are duly and promptly addressed. This role requires extensive coordination and teamwork with inter and intra-department officials.

STRATEGIC

  • Responsible for all cyber security governance framework along with other activities related to information and cyber security aspects as per the directions from Group Chief Information Security Officer.
  • Contribute to the formulation of, annual strategies, policies, and procedures of the Information Security Section, to support divisional and organizational business strategy.
  • Ensure that the Information Security plans are within agreed budgets and timescales. Assist the Country Manager & Group Chief Information Security Officer in preparing/providing timely, accurate, and complete progress reports to the Management reviews, RBI, IBA, IDRBT, CERT-In, CSITE, etc.
  • Update self on the IT/security industry trends, new solutions, and techniques, as well as emerging threats and regulatory requirements/changes set by QCB and other relevant government bodies, and suggest adequate changes in the section, including but not limited to the staffing of employees, department deliverables, etc.
  • Develop and maintain robust working relationships with internal/external stakeholders to facilitate functional/operational/ strategic needs.
  • Develop and maintain various performance monitoring checklists as required by ISO27001 /RBI Cyber Security Framework for IT and other operations.
  • Is well versed in cyber security governance framework and responsible for managing RBI - CSITE advisories, circulars, policy development, security operation center (SOC), vulnerability assessment and penetration testing, etc.
  • Member of Bank’s India Management Committee where information security-related risks, gaps, and remedial measures are discussed and tabled.

Job Requirement

OPERATIONAL

  • Ensure successful execution of ISO27001 & PCI-DSS and other industry certifications and governance of the certification programs and reporting the progress to management
  • Perform gap analysis of business operation to ascertain the magnitude of results in terms of non-compliance by the business/support functions with the statutory and regulatory requirements.
  • Liaise with external consultants appointed from time to time in assessing the adequacy and effectiveness of the Bank's information security efforts.
  • Perform the Risk assessment which would include identification, assessment, monitoring, and reporting of key information security risks and preparing the mitigating controls. Regularly follow up with Operational departments such as IT and Admin on implementing the mitigating controls with appropriate escalation.
  • Review and follow-up of Compliance with time-to-time applicable laws and regulatory requirements, third-party partners.
  • Ensuring Regular VAPT assessments / PCI / ISO27001 assessments, Internal, and external audits are properly planned and carried out. Also, track the compliance and provide updates/escalation to appropriate authorities. Need to Maintain an updated dashboard.
  • Track and update progress on the Internal /External Audit and VAPT observations and present suitably to Top Management, highlighting the high-risk areas and dependencies.
  • Manage and review Information Security analyses and submit assessment reports on the adequacy of control in accordance with policies, standards, and procedures to safeguard Bank's assets.
  • Depict threats and mitigation options to executive management and preparation of periodic (applicable weekly/ monthly /quarterly) Dashboards, reports, memos, and agenda items for the Information Security council, Risk Management Committee, Audit Committee of the Board, and further compliance of directions.
  • Review all data being generated from periodic threat assessments and ensure maximum accuracy. Revalidate observations with technical stakeholders and ensure that the observations from periodic assessments are accurate and complained.
  • Collection and consolidation of data required for monthly /quarterly /Half-yearly/ yearly - Report submissions / any other compliance reports as required by RBI and its appointed organizations/entities.
  • Submit periodic reports/data pertaining to India operations as required by the Information Security section, Head office including Bank’s defined internal KRI’s.
  • Ensure threats and mitigation measures are correctly populated into the threat register with accurate estimated dates of compliance and threat ratings as per the group’s methodology.
  • Participate actively during internal/external audits and regulatory reviews and ensure implementation of remediation actions on account of the findings reported.
  • Implement regular online/classroom training programs on information security awareness and conduct effective tests.

Qualification & Requirement

  • University Graduate with a degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or any other discipline.
  • 6-10 years of experience in similar position.

content:
About Pratilipi:

Founded in 2015 by a set of reading enthusiasts, Pratilipi is a storytelling platform which brings readers, writers and their stories together. Something that started as a reading platform we are now operating across three more products - Pratilipi Comics, Pratilipi FM, and IVM podcasts.

All the magic happens from a super cool office in Bangalore where we brainstorm, ideate, debate, and execute. Aggressive and fast paced, we motivate ourselves with meaningful disputes over infinite cups of tea.

Product Details

  • Online Literature (Core Product) – 12 languages, 360K+ writers, 5M+ stories, 28M+ MAU, 3b minutes total time reading. We record 3M+ new followers, 10M+ new ratings, and 2.5M+ new reviews on the platform every month. We are larger than other Indian online literature platforms combined.

  • Pratilipi Comics – Classic and in-house produced comics in 6 languages, 500+ Comic Series, 800K MAU

title: yulu - Manager, Recovery
subtitle: Location - Bangalore, Work Type: Full Time
content:
Job Description

About Yulu

Are you sick of breathing poor quality air in our cities? Do you worry about climate change? Have you felt like pulling your hair on seeing a congested red route on the Google map?

Did you nod in ‘yes’? Same here, we did too! And so, we at Yulu set out to fix all of these issues by making our mobility smart, efficient and sustainable.

Being India’s leading shared electric mobility player with the largest fleet of EVs and biggest Battery-as-a-Service network, Yulu is reimagining urban mobility for a better future. Not only do we provide an affordable, sustainable and accessible commute alternative to daily commuters, but we are also making last-mile goods deliveries cheaper and green. Simply put, we are revolutionizing the way urban India commutes and consumes by building the Mobility 2.0 paradigm.

We are innovating at the intersection of consumer behavior, public policies, urban infrastructure, cutting edge technology, deep learning, product design, supply chain innovation and economic inclusion. Our proprietary mobility platform uses IoT, Machine Learning, and AI for vehicle access, fleet management, intelligent demand-supply management, and efficient operations. After 3 years of building a strong foundation for electric mobility, now, as we are ready to feverishly scale our business 10x this year and 100x over the next 3 years by working on many new, complex & BIG challenges on technology, data, product, markets, customer segments and growth, we still feel we are just getting started!

If our mission brings a spark in your eyes & if you’d like to join some of the most passionate people in the country who are committed to transform the cacophony on Indian roads into a symphony - Come, join the #Unstoppable Yulu team!!

Key Responsibilities:

  • Recruit, train, develop and supervise a team of associated to achieve recovery goals and objectives.
  • Use proper de-escalation techniques to calm the situation and get to a resolution. Working with members with a helpful, mindful attitude or an approach of we are here to help find a resolution.
  • Monitors KPI performance and create tactical actions to improve performance of all recovery processes.
  • Cooperates across functions and leads interdependently to ensure everyone understands and contributes to the recovery process by focusing on prevention, revenue, sustainability and quality.
  • Testifies at legal proceedings as required.
  • Keeps management informed of asset recovery progress by overseeing and managing accurate reports for the Asset Recovery department.
  • Monitors team recovery statistics; performs account reviews and provides coaching, training and feedback.
  • Responsible to ensure the recovery process is compliant with all applicable regulatory & legal requirements.
  • Responsible for the training and development of staff for understanding of and compliance with regulations.

Key Requirements:

  • Experience: 6-8 years
  • Experience of recovering asset from fraudulent customers in the previous organizations.
  • Effectively optimise the recovery process & cost.
  • Proactive & smart thought process.
  • Excellent communication skills- English & Kannada (mandatory).
  • Data driven with experience of managing, leading and developing people.
  • E-Commerce, Logistics, Mobility background preferred.

We assure you

  • A friendly culture where you are encouraged to share ideas and opinions.
  • A journey that will challenge and reward you in multiple ways.
Apply

Job Description

About Yulu

Yulu is a technology driven mobility platform to enable Integrated Urban Mobility across public and private modes of transport. Using Micro Mobility Vehicles (MMVs) through a user-friendly mobile app, Yulu provides a seamless, shared and sustainable first and last-mile connectivity.

Yulu is built on a simple philosophy to make Urban Mobility Seamless, Shareable and Sustainable. What started off as an initiative to reduce traffic congestion and pollution in Indian cities is now redefining urban mobility in the global context.

We are a mission-driven company based out of India with an experienced founding team and big ambition. At Yulu, we believe that every day is a milestone and success is about making a difference. If you are passionate about the challenges of urban mobility, chaotic congestion and sustainable living, let’s have a conversation!

Our Website:

https://www.yulu.bike/

Role Summary

Yulu is looking for a Cluster Head who is passionate about building a culture of micro-mobility using MMVs. You will be reporting to the respective City Head. We split our operations in the city in smaller areas called Clusters. The operations include intra-cluster or inter-cluster relocation of bikes, conducting cleaning, minor repairs and maintenance on the spot, major repairs and maintenance at the workshop, maintaining the safety and security etc.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Launching Yulu in a new cluster or in areas of the existing cluster.
  • Running day-to-day operations and implementing the strategy for the cluster.
  • Represent Yulu at local events in your cluster and work with the Partnership team to create and strengthen relationships with the government and private bodies.
  • Being on the field to manage the operations and the on-ground team (bike engineers, bike marshals etc.) in the cluster; interacting with them.
  • Constantly evaluating the field operations, Implementing the standard operating procedures (SOPs), taking corrective actions and strengthening the position of Yulu.
  • Being on the field, interacting with the team working on the field and auditing the operations and conducting/arranging training as necessary.
  • Coordinating with the central control room for maximizing efficiency.
  • Being in regular contact with customers and getting their feedback.

You will be measured on the operational KPIs, e.g. the usage metrics of the MMVs, revenue, % utilization, customer satisfaction index, the efficiency of the fleet management etc. In short, this will be your dream job where you will contribute to making eco-friendly micro-mobility a way of life..

Key Requirements:

  • 4 – 5 years of experience in managing business and operation. Experience with (electric) fleet management, i.e. logistics, supply chain, business development will be an added advantage
  • Entrepreneurial with at least 2 years of experience with managing ground staff.
  • Deep understanding of the city in general.
  • Multi-tasker with a data-driven mind-set, comfort with technology.
  • Passion for mobility, urban planning, and sustainable living.
  • High integrity, good communication and interpersonal skills.

We assure you

  • A friendly culture where you are encouraged to share ideas and opinions.
  • A journey that will challenge and reward you in multiple ways.
  • A chance to work with revolutionary technology and AI based solutions.

title: yulu - UI/UX Designer
subtitle: Location - Bangalore, Work Type: Full Time
content:
Job Description

About Yulu

Are you sick of breathing poor quality air in our cities? Do you worry about climate change? Have you felt like pulling your hair on seeing a congested red route on the Google map?

Did you nod in ‘yes’? Same here, we did too! And so, we at Yulu set out to fix all of these issues by making our mobility smart, efficient and sustainable.

Being India’s leading shared electric mobility player with the largest fleet of EVs and biggest Battery-as-a-Service network, Yulu is reimagining urban mobility for a better future. Not only do we provide an affordable, sustainable and accessible commute alternative to daily commuters, but we are also making last-mile goods deliveries cheaper and green. Simply put, we are revolutionizing the way urban India commutes and consumes by building the Mobility 2.0 paradigm.

We are innovating at the intersection of consumer behaviour, public policies, urban infrastructure, cutting edge technology, deep learning, product design, supply chain innovation and economic inclusion. Our proprietary mobility platform uses IoT, Machine Learning, and AI for vehicle access, fleet management, intelligent demand-supply management, and efficient operations. After 3 years of building a strong foundation for electric mobility, now, as we are ready to feverishly scale our business 10x this year and 100x over the next 3 years by working on many new, complex & BIG challenges on technology, data, product, markets, customer segments and growth, we still feel we are just getting started!

If our mission brings a spark in your eyes & if you’d like to join some of the most passionate people in the country who are committed to transform the cacophony on Indian roads into a symphony - Come, join the #Unstoppable Yulu team!!

Our Website:

https://www.yulu.bike/

Role Summary

As a UI Designer, you would collaborate with product management and engineering to define and implement innovative solutions for the product direction, visuals and experience. You would be executing all visual design stages from the concept to final hand-off to engineering apart from conceptualizing original ideas that bring simplicity and user friendliness to complex design roadblocks.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Responsible for all product releases. Ensure timely, stable and well-tested releases including the android app, web app and backend releases
  • Devise and manage QA processes
  • Coordinate with product managers, design team, engineering team, and the QA team to deliver results.
  • Pioneer the designing of Dashboards.
  • Facilitate sprint planning, retrospective and other scrum meetings. Help the team estimate and increase velocity.
  • Monitor the progress of the sprint, devise process and suggest improvements regularly

Key Requirements:

  • Minimum of 2+ years of experience as a visual designer, user experience designer, interaction designer, or similar role.
  • An innate capacity for creating engaging, highly usable designs and layouts
  • Understand product specifications and user psychology while designing
  • Ability to quickly turn around rigorous wireframes and mockups in a visual design.
  • Experience creating style guides, pattern libraries, and other design solutions that drive design across organizations.
  • Experience working with agile development teams.
  • An online portfolio or samples of work demonstrating experience creating great user-centered design solutions and UI design expertise involving Dashboard designing.
  • Experience in a variety of design and prototype tools such as Sketch, Figma, Photoshop and Wireframing.
  • An innate capacity for creating engaging, highly usable designs and layouts
  • Understand product specifications and user psychology while designing
    • Please include your Dribbble, Behance or links to your portfolio while applying.

We assure you

  • A friendly culture where you are encouraged to share ideas and opinions.
  • A journey that will challenge and reward you in multiple ways.

title: lendingkartcareers - Lead Designer
subtitle: Location - Bangalore, India, Karnataka, India, Work Type: Full Time
content:
About the TEAM

  • Lendingkart is an online financing company dedicated to helping entrepreneurs and small businesses with working capital loans.
  • We use Analytics and Big data scoring to evaluate our customer’s business. We are a small and motivated team of bankers, data scientists, and techies trying to make a difference in the world of small business financing.
  • At Lendingkart we approach to design the way that we approach everything else. We love building great products, we love delighting our customers, we love turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution that truly solves customer needs.

About the ROLE

  • We’re looking for talented Product Designers to join us in our journey of reinventing Lendingkart. We have a groundbreaking vision for our product and exciting challenges to solve.
  • Each product team operates independently, with its own tech and common design resources. This not only allows for fast-paced development and pivots, it facilitates passionate, close-knit teams that work closely together to achieve their goals.
  • If you genuinely love what you do, are driven and passionate, then we want to hear from you.

What you’ll be DOING

We don’t follow the traditional corporate model, but empower our people to own their work end-to-end, that’s what you’ll be in charge of in the Product team: lead the product from a design perspective, having a holistic approach on the experience, from discovery to delivery – always keeping in mind our customers and their interests!

  • You will be partnering with the Product Owners, Engineers, Data Scientists, and other colleagues, working in a cross-functional and distributed team. Together, you will be actively involved in defining the customers’ and the business’ problems.
  • You’ll identify the key metrics for the projects you are involved in and take ownership for achieving their success.
  • You will research and bring forward new findings and learnings for reaching complex company goals – such as launching in new territories and offering new products.
  • From wire-framing to designing end-to-end flows and prototypes, you will be in charge of designing products that solve problems in a simple and elegant way while taking care of every small detail.
  • We love turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution that truly solves customer needs, thus you will be running user testing workshops and guerrilla testing
  • Once that’s done, iterate, implement with the technical team, and present the final solution during the design reviews;
  • We are not stopping here, we believe in continuous improvement, so you’ll review the performance of the release, identify learnings and find ways to enhance it.
  • To ensure we are speaking the same language as a team, we have the support of a design system – so you’ll kick in!
  • As a Lead Designer, you will have more responsibility around hiring, people management, and ownership of the product (or family of products) that you work on. You will also interact with our most senior stakeholders, and you will closely mentor a small team of Designers.

What you’ll NEED

  • 6+ years of experience in designing world-class complex commercial apps
  • A portfolio featuring examples of product design work
  • Strong design skills across Android and web platforms
  • The ability to think at a high level about product strategy and clearly articulate design decisions
  • The ability to understand technical implications in their design decisions
  • The ability to take ownership of design process and work as self-directed member of the development team
  • Strong UX focus and understanding of human behaviour
  • Clean visual design sense
  • Skills in typography and grids
  • Love to solve problems and be challenged
  • To be a constant learner. You will be always growing – both personally and with the team

Our PHILOSOPHY

At Lendingkart, we believe that working with people of different backgrounds and perspectives help us to elevate and build a better product for our users.

We’re committed to providing all employees with a work environment that celebrates individuality and remains free from any form of discrimination and harassment. We base our employment decisions on the needs of our business, job requirements, and applicants’ qualifications. In other words, we only care that you’re the best person for the job.

All the best

title: lendingkartcareers - National Collection Managers
subtitle: Location - Ahmedabad, Work Type: Full Time
content:
Job Overview:

  • Designation : National Collections Manager
  • Location :Ahmedabad

POSITION DESCRIPTION

Lead and organize collections for the organisation to deliver sustainable profit by maximizing collections and recovery through different channels; Provide support and guidance in collections related matters to the team/ collection’s agencies/ partners; Develop robust processes & models to drive high collections across multiple defined buckets for minimizing losses and maximizing recovery from delinquent customers.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Business planning

  • Formulate strategy for the Collections function across all products
  • Participate in business reviews conducted for Collection on a periodic basis and recommend for course correction wherever required
  • Develop detailed plans for collections function including overall cost, manpower requirements, geographic spread, etc. and present to the CEO for approval
  • Develop plans for managing collections within defined bounce buckets and ensure there are contingency plans for emergent situations
  • Ensure collections field team is being supported with required guidance and check whether there are collections agencies are there in the area. And accordingly plan the capacity
  • Formulate strategy, along with the supervisor, for reduction in collections related expenses and loan losses as well as increasing penal interest collections
  • Define targets for penal interest collection & recoveries, develop action plans to achieve the set targets, and seek sign off from supervisor
  • Scan the market, identify best/ innovative practices in collections and drive initiatives for minimizing losses and maximizing recovery from delinquent customers
  • Ensure geographic expansion of Collections team in line with business expansion to ensure front end reach and thereby maximum collection in the earlier buckets itself

Partner management

  • Guide the team to identify collection agencies, evaluate capabilities and negotiate for partnership to drive high collections
  • Design and propose incentives for collection agencies & officers to ensure they remain incentivized to maximize the collections.
  • Periodically review performance of collections agencies enlisted, provide performance feedback to ensure desired service levels and on target performance

Collection’s review

  • Monitor collections for various defined buckets, (bucket x, 1, 2, 3) identify issues/ challenges faced by collections officers/ agencies in driving collections and provide resolution for them
  • Deploy different set of new approaches for different markets based on risk and delinquencies and create capacity for future bounces in alignment with the approved budgets
  • Present Collection performance across metrics including loss provisions for review to the President, deliberate on deviations from planned goals and seek inputs on course correction, if required
  • Set guidelines for team in terms of approach to achieve collections targets and review their performance on a timely basis to ensure overarching business and profitability goals are achieved
  • Team development
  • Participate in recruitment process to identify the right talent at senior positions within the function
  • Establish individual performance expectations and regularly review individual performance of the team
  • Identify and create development opportunities, training, induction sessions for team members to enhance functional knowledge

GENERAL QUALIFICATIONS

  • Educational Qualifications – Post-graduation in any field
  • Work Experience – 12-18 years of experience maximum
  • Age : 42 years maximum
  • Significant experience in retail lending collections management

title: udaan - Underwriter
subtitle: Location - Bangalore, Karnataka, India, Work Type: Full Time
content:
udaan is a B2B ecommerce platform that brings traders, wholesalers, distributors, retailers, and manufacturers in India on to a single platform. Our goal is to make ‘doing business’ easy in India & make B2B commerce convenient and efficient.

udaan Capital is the NBFC arm of Udaan & offers credit services to buyers and sellers on and off udaan’s B2B ecommerce platform to grow their business further. This space is largely untapped with less than 10% of MSMEs having access to working capital loans from financial institutions. In this way, udaan is uniquely positioned to formalize &scale trade credit.

Learn more about us: https://udaan.com/

Role Description

Function: Credit

Sub Function: Seller Side

Location: Bangalore

Reports to: Head Underwriting

Travel Frequency: Minimal

Department Hierarchy

Credit Policy

Experience range

1 year - 3 years

Job Responsibilities

  • Deciding trade credit for buyers (lending amount & period)
  • Responsible completion of timely credit appraisals
  • Adhering to strict TAT for underwriting files
  • Maintaining quality of underwriting as per SOP
  • Recommending deviation cases to the higher level or approving authority as per delegation matrix
  • Vendor Management

KRAs of the role

  • Delinquency Management – Maintain lower NPAs
  • TAT Management – Strict TAT to be maintained for underwriting files
  • Managing Quality of Processing – to maintain quality of underwriting adhering to SOP
  • Vendor Management – coordinate with vendors for getting various verification done for customers

Functional Competencies

  • Problem Solving: Resolution of overdue accounts by coordinating with a sales team. Coordination with Operations team for due/ overdue PDD process
  • Stakeholder Management: Meet Customers to understand them better for better credit appraisal
  • Cross-functional integration: Coordinate with sales and operations team for efficient functioning of the entire process

Candidate Profile

  • Qualification: CA/MBA Finance/B. Com
  • Must have a minimum 1 - 3 years of work experience in SME underwriting for products like Invoice Finance, Business Loans; prior experience in Fintech/NBFCs preferred
  • Thorough understanding of SME Financing and Credit processes
  • Good at market intelligence, should be able to provide inputs & feedback for policy and process improvement
  • Eye for detail/Diligent Personality
